Us: stop whitewashing black and brown characters, learn how to eyedrop colors and do it better
Yall: uhh,, when Will the mean es...
body:
Us: stop whitewashing black and brown characters, learn how to eyedrop colors and do it better

Yall: uhh,, when Will the mean es jay wees stop the bullying of innocent artists Who are above all criticism??? When will the ugly antis shut up and let me be racisist in peace??? Its uhhh its the LIGHT source!!! Sure im lightening a dark skin tone but im doing it for the Aesthetique!!! Its not racitsis if im making a dark skin lighter just so its more pleasant to the eye :))) its just how things are. IF YOU STOP TO THINK ABOUT IT, you,re the real racism becauseyou draw canon light skin characters dark :)) what i lack in critical thinking skills i make up for with my victim complex

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Genesect
body:
649: Genesect

And finally, Gen 5 comes to a close, ending off with one final direct parallel to Gen 1. Genesect is an artificial Pokemon created by Team Plasma, a clone from an ancient Pokemon much like Mewtwo is a clone of Mew. In the story, Genesect was meant to be a weapon for Team Plasma to use, but N shut down the project for being an abhorrent disrespect of ancient, extinct Pokemon, but Genesect came to be in secret anyway. And with how much Gamefreak seems to just adore giving these guys different forms, I’m surprised there isn’t a form where you get to see Genesect’s original, unweaponized self. But hey, I’ll definitely appreciate the Bug type finally making it into Legendary status. No less that this happens in the same generation with the pseudo-legendary moth monster and the one that’s introduced the most Bugs to date. Like I said, Gen 5′s really nice to Bugs.

So it’s with a heavy heart that I say… Genesect isn’t a Pokemon that wows me too much. It’s interesting, and I appreciate a lot about it, but it doesn’t have a lot of my taste going on in that design. I like the face and head of the thing, and how it can transform. And again, it’s a clever parallel with Mewtwo in that it’s a full on cybernetically enhanced clone of an extinct Pokemon. It’s even a Pokemon with a gun. But Genesect just doesn’t surprise me enough, I suppose. It may be a Bug type, but it doesn’t capture a ton of what I love about bugs. I’m still holding out that Gamefreak can make some Legendary Bug monsters, cause what I had a bit more in mind would be things like colossal moths, scarab beetles, or something a lot more like a prehistoric insect reaching massive sizes. I know Pokemon Bugs are already impossibly huge but that’s all the more reason to go even bigger.

I think that’s another thing going against Genesect for me here. As far as I’m aware, it doesn’t take after any one particular insect, let alone a prehistoric one. Which wouldn’t necessarily be a bad thing on its own, but it doesn’t capture the overall feel of one, you know? It’s pretty reliant on the “cybernetically enhanced bug” look that it might as well have been an entirely man-made Pokemon like Porygon or Type: Null. Heck, its body is similar enough to Scizor that you could’ve called it a robo-Scizor.

All that said though, it’s still a plenty competent design that sticks to its guns (hah) with a plenty imposing cannon and a cool visage. It’s just that little bit underdeveloped and it keeps it as a Pokemon I like more than a Pokemon I love.

Personal Score: 8/10

It just feels like a Legendary Bug aught to be a shoe-in for being a top fave of mine, but nah. An 8/10 will suffice.

…And that’s… finally it for Gen 5! A bittersweet moment, as next time, we’ll be saying goodbye to my favorite Generation in one last hurrah of the usual Retrospective!

[Archive]

tags: and i loved making designs for them
summary: Elgyem/Beheeyem gijinka duo! They’re sisters and they’re determined to explore the Earth together! Beheeyem is an alien...
caption:
Elgyem/Beheeyem gijinka duo!

They’re sisters and they’re determined to explore the Earth together! Beheeyem is an alien researcher, she’s aloof and logical, and often misunderstands how things work since she’s so rooted in her own assumptions. Elgyem is her tiny helper, who’s innocently fascinated by everything new. She’s nonverbal and instead communicates with the lights on her hands, so only Beheeyem knows what she’s saying.

summary: you can tell I played in a Pokemon RPG for six years because every time I'm reminded that Magic Missile requires neither an...
body: you can tell I played in a Pokemon RPG for six years because every time I’m reminded that Magic Missile requires neither an attack roll nor a save and thus always hits unless certain countering spells are used, I go, “oh, yes, it’s the same rules as Swift”

- VOTE in the realistic Omnis Pokemon fanart contest!

- VOTE on Team Equinox Admin Wesley’s Signature Pokemon!

summary: Here’s my (first!) Omnis Crobat submission, based on thebigdeepcheatsy’s prompt! The idea is that Omnis Crobat lost their...
caption:
Here’s my (first!) Omnis Crobat submission, based on thebigdeepcheatsy’s prompt! The idea is that Omnis Crobat lost their ability to fly due to the cold weather of the region, but they can jump and glide!

“The cold weather of the Omnis Region caused Crobat to lose its ability to fly. Despite this, it is very agile and can glide from incredible heights.”

“Crobat started learning Fire type moves to keep themselves warm during the winter, causing its appearance to change. In battle, they shoot fire balls from their wings.”

reblog.comment:
Here’s my (first!) Omnis Crobat submission, based on thebigdeepcheatsy’s prompt! The idea is that Omnis Crobat lost their ability to fly due to the cold weather of the region, but they can jump and glide!

“The cold weather of the Omnis Region caused Crobat to lose its ability to fly. Despite this, it is very agile and can glide from incredible heights.”

“Crobat started learning Fire type moves to keep themselves warm during the winter, causing its appearance to change. In battle, they shoot fire balls from their wings.”
